items.title: Trump Administration Plans a Shake-Up at ICE to Speed Deportations
items.summary: The preliminary plan stems from frustration over the pace of the deportations, which are lagging behind President Trump’s demands.

items.title: Immigration Crackdown Spreads Through Chicago, Including Wealthy Neighborhoods
items.summary: Federal agents detained a man on the city’s North Side on Friday, and residents emerged from their homes, yelling and blowing whistles.

items.title: Justice Department Will Monitor Elections in California and New Jersey
items.summary: The Trump administration said that monitors will watch polling in two states, led by Democrats, where key races or issues are on the ballot.

items.title: Trump Leaves Behind a Reeling Washington to Chase a Deal With China
items.summary: President Trump is embarking on a six-day diplomatic tour of Asia, testing his role as a statesman and negotiator as he pursues a trade deal with Beijing.

items.title: Bannon Claims ‘There Is a Plan’ for Trump to Run for a Third Term
items.summary: The claim comes after months of President Trump toying with the idea, insisting that he is “not joking” about defying a constitutionally-mandated term limit.

items.title: D.C. Seeks to Block National Guard Deployment in Court
items.summary: During a hearing on Friday, lawyers told a judge that National Guard troops sent from Republican-led states had been conducting conduct law enforcement work.

items.title: Trump says he would be open to meeting Kim Jong-un as he embarks on whirlwind Asia tour
items.summary: <p>The trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised the prospect of meeting the North Korean leader</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/24/trump-asia-tour-key-questions-xi-jinping-china-japan-south-korea-malaysia"><strong>Trump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tour</strong></a></p></li></ul><p>Donald Trump has embarked on a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – telling reporters that he was also open to a meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.</p><p>Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/24/trump-asia-tour-key-questions-xi-jinping-china-japan-south-korea-malaysia">is set for a five-day trip</a> to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first to the region since taking office in January.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/25/trump-open-to-meeting-kim-jong-un-asia-tour-japan-korea-xi-jinping">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: What is the White House East Wing and why has it been torn down in Trump’s renovation plans?
items.summary: <p>President Donald Trump is adding a $300m ballroom to the White House – but that plan has come at the cost of the historic East Wing</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/24/white-house-demolition-east-wing-trump-ballroom"><strong>East Wing of White House reduced to rubble as part of Trump’s ballroom construction</strong></a></p></li></ul><p>It was confirmed on Friday that the East Wing of the White House has now been completely destroyed, days after construction started on the planned $300m (£225m) ballroom that Donald Trump is adding to the historic building.</p><p>The demolition marked a reversal of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/23/trump-white-house-ballroom-reaction">Trump’s earlier promise in July</a> that none of the White House’s existing infrastructure would be torn down during construction of the ballroom.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/25/what-is-the-white-house-east-wing-and-why-has-it-been-torn-down-in-trumps-renovation-plans">Continue reading...</a>
